conversations.response: Depending on your state  s laws and your personal circumstances, alimony (also called spousal support) may be awarded during a divorce. It can be temporary or permanent, though permanent support is less common today.
Hello!,How can I help You

Establishing paternity creates a legal relationship between a father and child. This can be done through voluntary acknowledgement, genetic testing, or other legal means. It may entitle the child to financial support and the father to visitation rights.

Collaborative divorce is an option for couples who want a cooperative, less contentious divorce process. It allows them to work together on agreements regarding finances, child custody, and other important matters without going to court.

After a divorce or separation, co  parents may create parenting agreements. These define where the children will live, visitation schedules, and who makes decisions about things like education and healthcare.

Victims of abuse, stalking, or harassment by family members can seek temporary or permanent restraining orders. These are court orders that reduce or eliminate contact between the abuser and the victim.

When deciding who keeps the marital home during a divorce, courts may consider factors such as who will have physical custody of the children and whether the home equity was acquired using separate or community funds.

If your ex  spouse refuses to pay child support, document each instance of non  payment. If the issue can  t be resolved privately, you can seek enforcement or file a contempt action through the court.

Family members such as stepparents, grandparents, aunts, and uncles are often given preference in adoption cases. Courts typically consider it in the child  s best interest to be placed with a relative when possible.

If your financial or personal circumstances have significantly changed, you may request a temporary or permanent modification of the alimony amount you are paying or receiving as part of your divorce settlement.
In most states, if your ex wants to move to another state with your children, they must either give you a chance to contest the move or seek court approval through a formal petition process.

conversations.topic: WHAT DOCUMENTS SHOULD A PERSON CARRY WHEN DRIVING   RIDING
conversations.response: Driving License  Registration Certificate  Emission Test Certificate    Pollution Under Control Certificate.  Insurance Certificate  Fitness Certificate, Permit and tax paid certificate (in case of transport vehicles)  Documents should be carried in original or shown on DigiLocker or mParivahan Application

conversations.topic: WHAT ARE THE CONSEQUENCES FOR DRIVING WITHOUT A LICENSE
conversations.response: You will penalized with fine of 1000     for Two    Three Wheeler, Rs.2000     for LMV and Rs.5000 for other Vehicles. The registered owner or the person in charge of vehicle is also penalized for the same amount if he allows a person without license to drive    ride the vehicle.

conversations.topic: WHO IS AUTHORIZED TO COLLECT SPOT FINE FOR TRAFFIC VIOLATIONS
conversations.response: Any Traffic officer of and above the rank of Assistant Sub  Inspector of Police is duly authorized to collect spot fine for traffic violations.

conversations.topic: I HAVE RECEIVED A NOTICE FROM THE TRAFFIC ENFORCEMENT AUTOMATION CENTRE. WHAT SHALL I DO
conversations.response: YOU CAN PAY THE FINE AT   Traffic Head Quarters, 5th Floor, Enforcement Automation Centre, Infantry Road, Bengaluru 560001.  Any of the 44 Traffic Police Stations in Bengaluru City.  Any Traffic Officer empowered to collect fine in Bengaluru City  Any Bengaluru  One centers.  Online at https:    btp.gov.in or https:    karnatakaone.gov.in

conversations.intent: WHY HAVE I RECEIVED A VIOLATION TICKET FOR THE VEHICLE I HAVE ALREADY SOLD
conversations.topic: WHY HAVE I RECEIVED A VIOLATION TICKET FOR THE VEHICLE I HAVE ALREADY SOLD
conversations.response: SEAT BELT

conversations.topic: WHAT IS THE RULE REGARDING SEAT BELTS   IS IT MANDATORY TO USE SEAT BELTS WHILE DRIVING IN INTERIOR AREAS OR BY LANES
conversations.response: Occupants in car must wear seat belts while vehicle is in motion (U  S 194  B of MV Act).

conversations.topic: CAN I USE HANDS FREE DEVICE FOR USING MOBILE PHONE WHEN DRIVING
conversations.response: Not only using mobile phones, even using hands free devices to access mobile phones (earphones, Bluetooth headset, etc.,) while driving is an offence. You are allowed to use mobile phone when driving    riding for navigation purpose only...

conversations.intent: CAN OTHER OCCUPANTS OF THE MOTOR VEHICLE USE THE MOBILE PHONE
conversations.topic: CAN OTHER OCCUPANTS OF THE MOTOR VEHICLE USE THE MOBILE PHONE
conversations.response: With the exception of the driver other occupants of the motor vehicle can use a mobile phone. However the passenger should not facilitate the use of mobile phone by the driver by holding the mobile phone to the driverâ€™s ear.
